Syria's last embroiderers: 'I lost my home and my fields, but I always kept this bag'
subhead: A symbol of the country's diversity, Syrian embroidery nearly disappeared during the 13 years of civil war. Since the fall of Bashar al-Assad in late 2024, a group of women led by a German woman in her 70s has been trying to keep this age-old art alive.

title: On France's coast, far-right British activists try to stop migrant crossings
subhead: Since summer 2024, radical British groups have periodically traveled to the French shores of the English Channel, aiming to 'stop the boats' and protest what they describe as a migrant invasion.

subhead: The Tunisian director, known for her hybrid-style films, shares an emotional filmmaking experience with Palestinian actors.

title: The lawyer suing far-right French mayors for setting up Nativity scenes
subhead: French courts have repeatedly ruled that installing Nativity scenes in town halls is a breach of the 1905 law separating the churches and the state. Sophie Mazas works tirelessly to ensure the principle of 'laïcité' is enforced.

subhead: Far from consumerist extravaganzas like 'Black Friday' or 'Cyber Monday,' some people in France prefer to turn to secondhand and recycled goods for their holiday shopping. Juggling the risks of technical failure and the fear of being seen as 'cheapskates,' they share their experiences.

title: US national security strategy targets Europe and spares adversaries
